name: 10 UK Football Questions | Sports Trivia Quiz

questions.text: Which London team's ground is Craven Cottage?
questions.explanation:
Fulham.

	Fulham is in West London. The ground is formerly the site of a house and grounds called .. Craven Cottage

questions.text: In which city is the team Aston Villa based?
questions.explanation:
Birmingham.

	Aston is an industrial quarter of Birmingham, also home to a university.

questions.text: Which team is the favourite of pop star Elton John?
questions.explanation:
Watford.

	Elton John was born Reg Dwight in {Watford;} he ended up as Chairman of his home town team.

questions.text: Which of the following teams is NOT based in or near Liverpool?
questions.explanation:
Charlton Athletic.

	Tranmere is across the Mersey. Liverpool is a big football city ...

questions.text: Which celebrity chef supported Norwich City?
questions.explanation:
Delia Smith.

	Delia Smith was a director of Norwich City and even ran a restaurant at the ground.

questions.text: What is the full name of the team QPR?
questions.explanation:
Queens Park Rangers.

	Queens Park is a suburb in north west London. The QPR ground is close to the BBC TV headquarters.

questions.text: Which British city is home to fierce rivals Rangers and Celtic?
questions.explanation:
Glasgow.

	Traditionally, Protestants support Rangers, and Catholics support Celtic.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a football ground?
questions.explanation:
Brent Cross.

	Brent Cross was a shopping centre. Craven Cottage is home to Fulham, White Hart Lane to Tottenham Hotspur and Stamford Bridge to Chelsea.

questions.text: Where is the English FA final traditionally played?
questions.explanation:
Wembley & London & Wembley Stadium.

	Wembley Stadium was being completely rebuilt for the 21st century.

questions.text: Where did England captain Tony Adams and goalkeeper David Seaman play together?
questions.explanation:
Arsenal.

	Arsenal FC is based in the centre of Islington in north London. It is a source of great local pride with many shops and bars dedicated to it.
